poem:
Anna Steps Down

The queen slips off her throne,  
a magazine scepter set aside,  
her gaze now just a memory  
that once steered fabric rivers  
down runways of light.

In the wake, a silence  
stitched with echoes of scissors,  
hems unraveling slightly  
as if to say  
fashion, too, can breathe.
